page.shortlink: api objects security object login method
page.description: logs in a user to a specific page and sets the authentication cookie's lifetime.
page.prototype: Context.Security.Login as L (UserName as C, Password as C, RedirectPage as C = null_value(), ClientCookie as L = .F., DaysUntilExpiration as N = 10)

argument.name: RedirectPage
argument.description: The page the user will be redirected to on successful login. If not specified the application defined redirect page will be used.

argument.name: ClientCookie
argument.description: Set to .T. to create a persistent cookie. This type of cookie will remain across browser sessions. That is, if you close your browser and restart the cookie will be available. When set to .F. the cookie will not be available across browser sessions. The cookie is deleted when close your browser. This is the default and is a more secure setting.

argument.name: DaysUntilExpiration
argument.description: The number of days the authentication cookie is valid. This is calculated from the time of the last request made with the cookie.

return.name: result
return.description: Returns .T. if the user is logged in; otherwise .F.

page.discussion: Context.Security.Login() logs in a user and optionally letting you redirect the successful login to a specific page and set the authentication cookie's lifetime. When login is successful the Context.Security.CallResult.ReturnDataValue will contain the redirect page URL. Check *[link:Context.Security.CallResult.Success@./index.xml#section1_CallResult]* before using the return value.
